tool.name: Auto-reopen
tool.description: attempts to automatically re-open phage genomes based on various heuristics.

param.name: reference
param.label: Phage Genome
param.help: Must provide a phage reference genome in fasta format, as a unique contig. Multi-fasta not accepted.

param.name: fastq1
param.label: FASTQ file r1
param.help: Must provide a file containing sequencing reads in fasta format, from Illumina TruSeq Technology or other randomly sheared DNA preparation method.

tool.help:
This software relies on PhageTerm:
PhageTerm software is a tool to determine phage termini and packaging mode from high throughput sequences that rely on the random fragmentation of DNA (e.g. Illumina TruSeq). Phage sequencing reads from a fastq file are aligned to the phage reference genome in order to calculate two types of coverage values (whole genome coverage and the starting position coverage). The starting position coverage is used to perform a detailed termini analysis. If the user provides the host sequence, reads that does not match the phage genome are tested on the host using the same mapping function. Source: https://sourceforge.net/projects/phageterm/.
